channel.title: 667+ Particles?
channel.description:
I'd like to know more about particles. The extent of my knowledge on them is only how to add them to a model.
What I'd like to know about them includes:
How are they generated? Where do the "patterns" come from? (are they cache-based, or is it some Class, or is it completely separate?) If they're cache-based, what index are they in? How would I go about making custom patterns? (I might need to figure this one out myself once the others are answered) I've seen videos where a user can change the color of the pattern. How is THAT done? (note: when I say "pattern" I mean the way it moves (gravity, length of time shown, direction, etc.))
If anyone would help me find these answers, it'd be really appreciated.

item.title: 667+ Particles?
item.dc:creator: @MeeE59 MeeE59
item.description:
@MeeE59 wrote:

Alright, thanks. Any idea where they may be in the client and/or cache?

I don’t know if they’d be in a cache index, but I mean, it’s totally possible I assume. If it’s a simple .dat file that holds color info (probably a short, maybe 3 bytes to include alpha), gravity (probably a byte, with 7f being stationary, 00 being fastest upward and ff being fastest downward), texture id (some particles have texture, I guess), particle generation rate (no clue on this one) and number of particles allowed at a time (could be a short, up to 65535 particles at a time could get really laggy), maximum deviation from main direction (could be a byte), and direction (dunno about this), then I think I might be able to figure it out. Of course, these data structures are just guesses based on prior knowledge (mostly model formats of 317s). I haven’t done any searching through anything, so I’m probably not even close. I’m also extremely tired so if this seems like total gibberish it probably is.
